intro: Chromolaena mornicola, commonly known as the yellow chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow and clustered in dense inflorescences. Chromolaena mornicola is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain areas.
